benchmark_details.name: ML-B ENCH
benchmark_details.overview: ML-B ENCH is a benchmark that evaluates Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI agents on repository-level code understanding and executable code generation tasks using real-world programming applications drawn from existing code repositories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs and AI agents on their ability to understand and generate code within the context of repository-level tasks.

data.source: 18 GitHub repositories containing diverse programming tasks and examples.
data.annotation: Annotated by computer science graduate students with proficiency in programming.

methodology.calculation: Pass@5 measures the likelihood of the model producing at least one correct code execution in five attempts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Pass@5 scores indicate better model performance in generating executable code.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o achieved a Pass@5 rate over 50%.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using annotated examples across various tasks from 18 GitHub repositories.
